publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-278 Margaret Mitchell: Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel—That the Parliament recognises the many potential dangers facing young people using the internet from paedophiles and adults attempting to "groom" youngsters; notes that it is vital that parents, schools, local communities and the police work together to protect youngsters from such threats, and congratulates the Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel for publishing and distributing its leaflet A parent’s guide to internet safety, aimed at helping educate parents and children about the risks for children using the internet, which is an excellent example of communities working together to eradicate such crime.
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) Phil Gallie*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Donald Gorrie*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) John Scott*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) Dr Jean Turner*, Alex Neil*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) John Swinburne*
S2M-278 Hamilton District Crime Prevention Panel (lodged on 27 August 2003) Linda Fabiani*
